English: We have driven off the hated Yankee invader, at least for now. Victory has further cemented the role of slavery in $COUNTRY$ and it will take at least another generation before any serious suggestions to outlaw slavery will be heard in the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ legislature.
We can expect this issue to linger for some time.
Extensive use of artifical fertilizers and pesticides and antibiotics allow crops and livestock to grow faster than ever before.
Local controlled-access highways, airports, and modern ships allow transportation at an unprecedented pace.

Wisps of white smoke dot the landscape, each marking the location of a mine and its steam-engines - fed from loose coal from the mine itself - which pump, haul, and hoist faster than any man or horse could. The mines in this province have undergone an Industrial Revolution.

Mother, mother! Old man Johnson has bought new tools! He doesn't have to cut and thresh his wheat by hand, he has machines that can do it for him! He says the one hauled his horse is called a 'mechanical reaper', and the steam-powered one a 'threshing machine!'\n\nThe spread of the mechanical reaper, threshing machine, and artifical fertilizers in $PROVINCENAME$ has led to great increases in agricultural output.
A fleet of steamboats are now servicing the waterways of $PROVINCENAME$, greatly aiding commerce in the area.
The military situation in $PROVINCENAME$ makes it difficult for boats to operate safely here. Many captains have decided to sail elsewhere or suspend their activies in $STATENAME$ altogether.
The Huang He bursts its banks yet again!
The enormous Yellow River has caused yet another flood!
The Yangtze River bursts its banks!
The enormous Yangtze River has flooded!
At least it's not the Huang He again...
The Yangtze River bursts its banks again!
The enormous Yangtze River has flooded once again!
The Haiyuan Earthquake was assigned the maximum intensity on the Mercalli intensity scale (XII Extreme). Aftershocks continued for 3 years.
Our troops, frustrated from Chinese resistance to our advance, have decided to sack and pillage the Chinese capital, Nanjing.
The international community would not like this...
$FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ troops, frustrated from our resistance to their advance, have decided to sack and pillage our capital, Nanjing.

The White Lotus sect, a millenarian movement forecasting the imminent advent of the "King of Light", the future buddha Maitreya, was responsible for the Red Turban Rebellion in 1351 which overthrew the Mongol-led Yuan Dynasty in 1368. This unsanctioned movement is once again active in plotting rebellion, having led or inspired revolts in 1774, 1786, 1794, and 1813. The most recent uprising involved a surprise assault the Forbidden City, where the Daoguang Emperor, then still a prince, personally fought off several rebel attackers.

Secret societies have long been centers of resistance against non-Han rule. Societies such as the Heaven and Earth Society was founded as a mutual aid society in 1761 but was forced into anti-Qing activity after the Qing decreed membership in secret societies illegal.
Secret societies are forbidden by law!
The Elder Brother Society, also known as the Hatchet Gang for the small hatchet every member carries, is a fraternal society that despises foreigners - both Manchu and Western.
What can a hatchet do against the Qing army?
Anti-Qing secret societies have recruited many members in $STATENAME$.
We have kept the foreigners at bay, for now, but they still greedily eye our lands. Passing land reforms will strengthen our economy and help us better resist the so-called `civilized` powers.

We have kept the foreigners at bay, for now, but they still greedily eye our lands. Passing administrative reforms will strengthen our realm and help us better resist the so-called `civilized` powers.
We have kept the foreigners at bay, for now, but they still greedily eye our lands. Passing education reforms will improve our research and help us better resist the so-called `civilized` powers.
We have kept the foreigners at bay, for now, but they still greedily eye our lands. Passing university reforms will improve our research and help us better resist the so-called `civilized` powers.
Tiandihui and Gelaohui members, inspired by the Red Turban Rebellion that overthrew the Yuan Dynasty, are sporting red turbans and rebelling against Qing rule.
The Red Turban rebels have been shattered and the remaining secret societies have returned to hiding.
The Red Turbans can now count two successful rebellions against barbarian rule - both the Mongol Yuan and the Manchu Qing have been toppled. China is once again ruled by the Han.

The disparate organizations that compose the Red Turbans, although united in opposition against the Qing, diverge in their vision of China's future. Victory and peace has exposed these cracks and a final decision on the distribution of power in the Red Turbans must be made.
The Tiandihui will revive the Ming!
The Gelaohui will expel the barbarians!
There's no problem with the current arrangement

After the end of the Red Turban Rebellion, former revolutionaries having trouble adjusting to peacetime and local militas and bandits not incorporated into the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ army have turned to drugs and extortion for income. Organizing themselves into underground cells, many have joined the Sanhehui (Triple Union Society), better known as the Triads, referring to the union of heaven, earth and humanity. They have - using a combination of threats and bribes - co-opted many officials and are in a good position to sieze power.
Stop these criminal organizations at any cost!

What began as groups of poor roaming peasants displaced by the Yellow River flood grew into larger and larger bandit gangs after years of Qing mismanagement. Finally, under Zhang Lexing, the bands were organized into a loose alliance of five banners of rebel troops.
A New Captial for Our Nation

$COUNTRY$ is united and many in the government argue that the current capital is not a suitable location to command our nation. A few proposals came forward for suitable cities that could replace it, now it's only a matter of choosing one.
Nanjing will be the new capital.
A new Chang'an will be founded as the capital.
Guizhou has been hotbed of anti-government unrest ever since the Ming dynasty. Once again, the locals have risen in revolt.
We have defeated the Miao rebels!

The Hakka, originally refugees from Central China, have been feuding with the Cantonese for generations. Another wave of against the Hakka has begun as the Cantonese vow revenge against Hakka collaborators with the Qing army.

The Taiping have overthrown the Qing dynasty. They claim to be Christians, but their rituals are mixed with strange Chinese practices, and more worryingly, their leader claims to be Jesus Christ's little brother! The Pope is considering how to respond to this development, and since we own Rome, we can influence the Holy See's decision.
They believe in God too, do they not?

INCOMPLETE DESC The Taiping have overthrown the Qing dynasty. Although the Taiping claim to be Christian, Southern Baptist missionary Issachar Jacox Roberts claims that the Taiping religion deviates too radically from real Christianity.
Teach the Chinese how to worship properly.

Rebels have overthrown the Qing dynasty, undoing years of hard work opening China up to our merchants. However, remnants of the Qing court survive in Manchuria. Perhaps with our support the Qing could restore order in China. Contacts in Manchuria say the Qing are ready to give us a concession if the plan were to succeed.

American missionaries, inspired by our nation's new Christian faith, have arrived in significant numbers, ready to spread the word of God. However, the entry of more discourteous foreigners and the differences between Taiping and Western Protestant doctrine may cause unrest and instability.
In his latest address to the Holy See, the Pope has denounced the Taiping religion and encouraged Catholic nations to attack.
The Pope has condemned the Taiping for heresy! This is the perfect chance to show the Chinese their place and obtain concessions from them.
Don't waste time with colonial adventures.
The Pope does not Condemn the Taiping
The Pope did not condemn the Taiping and hopes that the new Taiping church will protect Catholics and missionaries in China.
A mob has attacked our troops who were trying to demolish a non-Taiping temple. It appears the Tiandihui is still active and is organizing militas to oppose our Christianization efforts.
Resistance to Taiping Christanization efforts have increased to the point that secret societies across China are calling for open revolt against the Taiping.
The last of the Red Turban armies have been defeated and their sympathizers captured.
The last of the Taiping armies have been defeated and their heterodox cult discredited.
The treaty ceding the port Weihaiwei to $FROMCOUNTRY$ also stipulate giving $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ merchants trade access to the region.
There is no choice but to comply
For whatever reason, foreign merchants are having difficulty trading in this area.
The treaty ceding the port Qingdao to $FROMCOUNTRY$ also stipulate giving $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ merchants trade access to the region.
There is no choice but to comply
For whatever reason, foreign merchants are having difficulty trading in this area.
The treaty ceding the port Nantong to $FROMCOUNTRY$ also stipulate giving $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ merchants trade access to the region.
There is no choice but to comply
For whatever reason, foreign merchants are having difficulty trading in this area.
The treaty ceding the port Shanghai to $FROMCOUNTRY$ also stipulate giving $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ merchants trade access to the region.
There is no choice but to comply
For whatever reason, foreign merchants are having difficulty trading in this area.
The treaty ceding the port Jiaxing to $FROMCOUNTRY$ also stipulate giving $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ merchants trade access to the region.
There is no choice but to comply
For whatever reason, foreign merchants are having difficulty trading in this area.
The treaty ceding the port Ningbo to $FROMCOUNTRY$ also stipulate giving $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ merchants trade access to the region.
There is no choice but to comply
For whatever reason, foreign merchants are having difficulty trading in this area.
The treaty ceding the ports in Eastern Guangdong to $FROMCOUNTRY$ also stipulate giving $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ merchants trade access to the region.
There is no choice but to comply
For whatever reason, foreign merchants are having difficulty trading in this area.
The treaty ceding the ports in Western Guangdong to $FROMCOUNTRY$ also stipulate giving $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ merchants trade access to the region.
There is no choice but to comply
For whatever reason, foreign merchants are having difficulty trading in this area.

Revolutionaries seeking to bring down the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ have been stirring up a revolt in $STATENAME$. The authorities have already ambushed and cracked down on rebel cells in $PROVINCENAME$ with the help of informants, but key revolutionaries remain at large.

In order to avoid a liquidity crisis, money stored in treasuries is forcibly injected back into the economy. The max amount of money the treasury can hold is determined by population and Monetary System Technology. 
 No other conditions met: 2 mil ¤ 
 Ad Hoc Money Printing OR 8 mil pops (32 mil population): 4 mil ¤ 
 Private Bank Money Printing OR 16 mil pops (54 mil population): 6 mil ¤ 
 Central Bank Money Printing OR 32 mil pops (128 mil population): 8 mil ¤ 
 Modern Central Bank System OR 64 mil pops (256 mil population): 10 mil ¤ 
 Market Determined Exchange Rates OR 128 mil pops (512 mil population): 15 mil ¤ 
 Fiat Money OR 256 mil pops (1024 mil population): 20 mil ¤  
 This event does not apply to the AI if it is at war.

The forces of revolution have turned against the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Government. With dissent threatening to spread into chaos, revolutionaries, mutinous New Army soldiers, and defecting governors have seized several provinces and declared a Republic of China in direct opposition to $COUNTRY_ADJ$ rule. The Beiyang Army has remained loyal to the $COUNTRY_ADJ$, however, there are signs that army leaders are holding negotiations with the revolutionaries and may launch a coup. Skirmishes between government and rebel troops have begun, and the fate of the nation is uncertain.

A city founded upon oil, for to its inexhaustible founts of naphtha it owes its very existence, its maintenance, its prosperity... the immense output in crude petroleum from this single city far surpasses that in any other district where oil is found... the rock poured me out rivers of oil. Oil is in the air one breathes, in one's nostrils, in one's eyes, in the water of the morning bath (though not in the drinking water, for that is brought in bottles from distant mineral springs), in one's starched linen – everywhere.\n$PROVINCENAME$ is home to one of the most productive oil fields in the world, but much of its potential remained untapped until now.

Generals of the Beiyang Army warn that they will be unable to protect the imperial palace if $CAPITAL$ were to fall to the rebels. They are, however, willing to negotiate with the rebels and offer a safe retirement for the Imperial Family. In case the Emperor refuses to abdicate, the generals claim that Beiyang troops are ready to assault the Imperial Palace and arrest the Imperial Court..

Emissaries from the Beiyang Army claim the Xinhai Revolution is too weak to achieve victory on its own. Many in the Beiyang Army are dissatisfied with the Emperor as well, and offer to force him to abdicate. In exchange, the Beiyang commander will be appointed the President of China. Accepting would prevent the chaos of a brutal revolutionary war and potential foreign intervention, but the dream of a democratic China may die under Beiyang military rule.

The Beiyang Army has deposed the Emperor. The presidency of the new Republic has been given to the Beiyang, ministers replaced by Beiyang appointees, and legislators are cowed by harassment and assassination - the Beiyang have not just usurped the Empire but the Republic as well.

$COUNTRY_ADJ$ overthrow of the previous dynasty did not expel the barbarian missionaries and merchants or end the unequal treaties negotiated by the old regime. We could declare the treaties void and expel the foreigners, at the risk of drawing the ire of their home countries.

Even though we are not yet done with the Red Turbans, the fact the rebels have forced us to a ceasefire and have not been crushed is being taken by our Chinese subjects as a sign of weakness. Officials are predicting rebellions in many other places in the years to come.

Though we are not yet done battling the hated Manchu, for the moment the Heavenly Kingdom claims victory. We have forced a truce, and now the Manchu will need to deal with rebellions across their land as the people realize their mandate to rule no longer exists. All the world watches us.
The War Against the Red Turbans

The continued existence of the Red Turban rebels is an embarrassment to the Qing government and our Emperor. Calls have been made for the war to resume, and this time for a national effort be started to draft men into the Qing army. There will be considerable resistance, but the Emperor has decreed that the Red Turbans must be destroyed!
The truce with the Qing Emperor has come to an end, and already the calls have begun for the Red Turban Revolution to continue. The Manchu must be thrown down! All of China must be freed!

The Qing has fallen, but united the rebellion is not. Some of our leaders feel the Taiping shows the most promise in rejuvenating China. Or perhaps the whole of China should be ruled directly from $CAPITAL$?

The Qing has fallen, but united the rebellion is not. Some of our leaders believe joining the Red Turbans would serve China best. Or perhaps the whole of China should be ruled directly from $CAPITAL$?

The Qing has fallen, but united the rebellion is not. Some of our leaders believe joining the Red Turbans would serve China best, yet others feel the Taiping shows the most promise in rejuvenating China. Or perhaps the whole of China should be ruled directly from $CAPITAL$?

Scientists in $COUNTRY$ have created a working atomic bomb. A test of their new weapon, conducted at a secret location, yielded excellent results. With continued military funding, mass production of this devastating weapon will soon be possible.
Production of atomic bombs in $COUNTRY$ has been streamlined and a large stockpile of nuclear weapons is ready for mass deployment.
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has annihilated several of our military installations - as well as the cities situated nearby.
$CAPITAL$ and several cities have been struck by nuclear bombs.
$CAPITAL$ and many cities have been struck by multiple nuclear bombs.

We have the choice to issue two types of ultimatums, one calling for the total capitulation of our enemies which will not be so readily accepted or to demand a white peace which would be more likely to be accepted. $COUNTRY_ADJ$ military planners have also prepared a list of possible targets that can be struck in a limited nuclear attack. This can make the difference between nuclear annihilation or the greatest victory $COUNTRY$ ever had.
$FROMCOUNTRY$ rejected our very generous demands and thus we have launched our nuclear warheads against them. Let's hope this will teach $FROMCOUNTRY$ not to mess with us anymore.

In order to avert a nuclear war with $COUNTRY$, the $FROMCOUNTRY$ leader has agreed to surrender to $COUNTRY$ with immediate effect. As part of the agreement, the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ military forces will occupy all provinces under the control of $FROMCOUNTRY$. Elements of the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ military have however refused to surrender and continue to attack our forces. Nevertheless, a peace deal should be close.

In order to avert a nuclear war with $COUNTRY$, the $FROMCOUNTRY$ leader has agreed to a ceasefire with $COUNTRY$. As part of the agreement, the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ and $COUNTRY_ADJ$ military forces will withdraw from all engagements with each other and seek to promote better relations to avoid another conflict. The international community has praised the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ leader for his restraint.

An issue at a nuclear reactor has lead to the release of significant amounts of radioactive material into the environment. Concerning amounts of radioisotopes have been detected in multiple locations, and it will take time for the contaminated areas to be safe again.
Radioactive fallout has drifted from a neighboring province to $STATENAME$.

It is the duty of the Government of this country, placed as it is with regard to geographical position, to keep itself upon terms of goodwill with all surrounding nations, but not to entangle itself with any single or monopolising alliance with any one of them, above all to endeavour not to interfere needlessly and vexatiously with the internal affairs of any foreign country. - Lord Edward Stanley, Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs. \n\nThe policy of 'splendid isolation' was characterised by Britain's reluctance to enter into permanent European alliances or commitments with the other great powers. During the late 19th century, Britain's primary goal in foreign policy was to maintain the balance of power in Europe and to intervene if that balance was upset. Its secondary goal was to protect its overseas interest in the colonies and dominions, as free trade kept the Empire alive.
The great Mother Empire stands splendidly isolated in Europe!

The Greek government has chosen to actively pursue a strategy of recovering Greek lands held by the Turks. We now have the political clout in the international stage to give a serious voice and weight to these claims. The question remains, however, in which parts we should focus on.
We are only interested in Pontus
Everything we can claim on the coast of the Black Sea!

Beginning as a Milanese boycott of Austrian tobacco products, unrest in Milan has recently hit new heights as mobs began to attack government buildings. More worringly, the Savoyards appear to be considering an intervention to support the Milanese insurgents.
We have to evacate Lombardia completely.
Milanese revolutionaries have contacted us, asking for our aid to expel the Austrians from Lombardy. This is a great pretense for us to unite Italy under the Savoyard flag.
They must fight on their own.

Revolutionaries have siezed control of the Venetian arsenal, naval yard, and munition depot. News spread reapidly and much of the state has joined the revolt, proclaiming a new Venetian republic. Field Marshal Radetzky was able maintain control over Verona, but the situation remains tense.
We have to evacuate Venetia completely.

Radical liberal and republican ideas are spreading from Venice and Milan into $COUNTRY$, threatening to destabilize our nation. By ending our support of those revolutionaries, we can stop the inflow of liberalism and mend our relations with Austria.
We will make peace with Austria.

During the Napoleonic Wars, liberal and Italian nationalist ideas spread into the Papal States, especially in Romagna. Riots in 1820 and 1830 were suppressed with only the aid of French and Austrian troops. Anti-papal societies are still active in Romagna and there remains significant liberal unrest.

Dissatisfied soliders revolted in June 1835 and demanded an end of the oligarchal government and the reconstitution of Gran Colombia. After loyal forces recaptured the capital and a pardon was issued, most of the rebels surrendered. The last of the revolutionaries are still holding out in San Felipe, but it should not take long before they are defeated as well.

Diplomats and other senior $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government figures in $CAPITAL$ are suggesting we organize a summit with other economically liberal leaders to discuss the current issues of our time. Our interdependent economies make maintaining good relations of vital importance if we aim to protect our globalized markets from disruption. As Immanuel Kant wrote: "the spirit of commerce... sooner or later takes hold of every nation, and is incompatible with war."
The natural effect of commerce is to lead to peace.
This is not in our interest at this time.

The 10-year-old Dom Pedro II, Emperor of Brazil, is yet too young to rule the country, due to his father abdicating in 1831 in order to restore his daughter Maria to her rightful throne of Portugal. Until the child Emperor is of age, the country will be looked over by parliamentary officials and a court of regents.
He will make a good leader, someday.

During the Warlord Era, the Kuomintang adopted a policy of "using the political party to run the state". The government and military were subordinate to Kuomintang as part of a three stage plan to reconstruct the nation. First, a period of martial law is necessary to secure a region. Once military operations conclude, a period of Political Tutelage is enforced to prepare the people for democracy. Only when political stability is achieved nationwide can $COUNTRY$ transition to a constitutional democracy. \nWith all of the warlords subjugated and China finally at peace, some say it is time to elect a new National Assembly, put the military under civilian control, and fufill the dream of the Xinhai Revolution.
It is not yet time to end military rule.

The Zimmerwald conference of the Socialist International, which convened on September 4 1915, was the first such meeting to follow the outbreak of the Great War in August of 1914. Whereas the previous meeting of the International, held in Basel in November 1912, had looked forward to the possibility of war as an opportunity to overturn the capitalist order, the horrendous casualties produced by the fighting led delegates at the Zimmerwald conference to denounce the war as the result of imperialism and called upon workers to resist its prosecution. Many prominent leaders of the Socialist movement gathered for this meeting, including Lazzari and Modigliani from Italy, Lenin and Bobrow from Russia, the Germans Ledebour and Hoffmann, French socialists Bourderon and Merrheim and many more..
End of the Bandar Abbas Lease

The Sultans of Oman and Zanzibar have leased Bandar Abbas and the surrounding lands from $FROMCOUNTRY$ since 1794. Now, with the threat of war, the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have unilaterally ended the lease and demand the return of our territory along the Persian Gulf.
They will have to take it from our cold, dead hands.

Due to its strategic position in the Straits of Johore, Singapore grew to become one of the most important ports in the world. After the opening of the Suez Canal, Singapore saw a monumental rise in trade volume, with trade alone accounting for more than one-third of GDP.
Singapore is turning in a large, bustling city. Merchants from all over the world come to Singapore to trade and the wealth moved in the city attracted people from all over China.
More people, more trade, more profit.

Tensions between ethnic Malays, Chinese, and Indians in Malaysia have flared for a long time. Now, unrest in Singapore is threatening to explode into chaos. By expelling Singapore from Malaysia we can reduce ethnic tensions and restore some order to our nation.
We can manage the Singapore problem.
Convention for the Extension of Hong Kong Territory

$FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ diplomats approached us proposing the lease of the Kowloon hills south of the Sham Chun River and the islands next to Hong Kong. It's a small area and it may be best to just lease it to them, as the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government doesn't look like it will handle a refusal pacifically.
We don't want to anger our $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ friends, do we?
They will have to take it from our cold, dead hands.
$FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ delegates have recently come in in hopes of purchasing Gwadar. What should we do?
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has agreed to sell Gwadar to us! Long live $COUNTRY$!
$MONARCHTITLE$, negotiations with $FROMCOUNTRY$ over Gwadar have stalled, and they have declined to sell us the port.

Our claims in Afghanistan are a constant source of conflict with the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government. In $YEAR$, the government of $FROMCOUNTRY$ prepared an agreement to fix the limits of their respective spheres of influence. Signing this agreement means relinquishing our claims in Afghanistan, but it also means normalizing relations with the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$.
We won't give up our claims.

Herat has long been under Persian influence. After the fall of the Durrani Empire, Persia has attempted fought several wars to capture Herat, with the most recent attempt in 1833 failing when Crown Prince Abbas Mirza passed away and Mohammad Mirza had to return to Tehran. The Persian army is once again ready to march onto Herat, but there are signs that the British may find this move uncomfortable.
Let us give up on Herat.

Herat is strategically located at the crossroads between India, Persia, and Central Asia. If Herat were to fall, India could be vulnerable to an invasion by Persia or Russia. We can threaten Persia with war to protect Herat, but we must also be careful if Perisa is weakened too much it could be easily dominated by Russia.
The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government has demanded our withdrawal from Herat, and threaten war if we refuse.
Let them come, if they dare.
The Persian government has yielded to British pressure and has withdrawn from Herat.
Zaranj has long been contested between Persia and its neigbors. With Herat back under Persian rule, some say is time to extend our borders East.
The rise of a united Afghan government has reduced our legitmiacy in the eyes of our subjects and abroad.
The newly united Afghan government claims all of $FROMCOUNTRY$, so it may be wise to scale down on our diplomatic efforts in $FROMCOUNTRY$ in favor of a strong and united Afghanistan.
The occupation of Nukus has prompted Khiva to raise a claim on the area.
The occupation of Western Sahara has prompted Morocco to raise a claim on the area.

As the armies of our former enemy depart $CAPITAL$, they leave behind a newly-installed theocratic government friendly to their nation. How long this government will last is unknown, but many within $COUNTRY$ question whether 'freedom' imposed by a foreign power is truly that.

French: Nous faisons bon accueil au nouveau régime.

English: The death of the arch-reactionary Pope Gregory XVI led to the election of the moderate Pope Pius IX. He immediately planned several reforms, including the release of political prisoners, greater involvement of laymen in the government, and a relaxation of restrictions on Jews.
